candidates.name: G band in graphene
candidates.rationale: 1579.94 cm⁻¹ corresponds to the G band in graphene, which is a common Raman-active mode for this material.

candidates.name: C=C stretching in aromatic ring
candidates.rationale: 1579.94 cm⁻¹ could correspond to the C=C stretching mode in an aromatic ring present in various organic compounds.

candidates.name: Si-C stretching in silicon carbide
candidates.rationale: 1579.94 cm⁻¹ might be attributed to the Si-C stretching mode in silicon carbide, although less common than the previous assignments.

candidates.name: C-H stretching vibration in aldehydes/ketones
candidates.rationale: The wavenumber and intensity are consistent with C-H stretching vibrations in aldehydes/ketones.

candidates.name: C-H stretching vibration in alcohols
candidates.rationale: C-H stretching vibrations in alcohols can also occur in this region, but it is less common than in aldehydes/ketones.

candidates.name: O-H stretching vibration in carboxylic acids
candidates.rationale: While O-H stretching vibrations in carboxylic acids can appear in this region, the intensity and FWHM are not typical for this assignment.
